questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT an objective for Phase B, Business Architecture?

discussion.content:
D. Selecting relevant viewpoints for key stakeholders

In Phase B, Business Architecture of the TOGAF ADM, the primary objectives are:

A. Defining the Strategic Business Plan
B. Describing the Baseline Business Architecture
C. Developing the Target Business Architecture

All of the objectives listed are associated with Phase B, Business Architecture.

Each objective serves a specific purpose in developing the business architecture. 

A. Defining the Strategic Business Plan sets the overall direction and goals of the architecture effort. 
B. Describing the Baseline Business Architecture provides a current state assessment of the organization's business architecture. 
C. Developing the Target Business Architecture defines the future state vision of the organization's business architecture. 
D. Selecting relevant viewpoints for key stakeholders ensures that the architecture is designed and communicated in a way that is relevant and useful to stakeholders.

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/
2 Objectives in Phase B:
1) Develop the Target Business Architecture that describes how the enterprise needs to operate to achieve the business goals, and respond to the strategic drivers set out in the Architecture Vision, in a way that addresses the Statement of Architecture Work and stakeholder concerns.
2) Identify candidate Architecture Roadmap components based upon gaps between the Baseline and Target Business Architectures. 
Steps of Phase B:
1 Select Reference Models, Viewpoints, and Tools.
2 Develop Baseline Business Architecture Description.
3 Develop Target Business Architecture Description.
4 Perform Gap Analysis.
5 Define Candidate Roadmap Components.
6 Resolve Impacts Across the Architecture Landscape.
7 Conduct Formal Stakeholder Review.
8 Finalize the Business Architecture.
9 Create the Architecture Definition Document.

choices.D: Selecting relevant viewpoints for key stakeholders

questions.question_text: Which one of the following is NOT an objective for Phase C, Data Architecture?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Builds Enterprise Data Architecture. It does not include detailing the individual entities.

Selected Answer: D
D. Defining data entities that are normalized to minimize update anomalies

Normalization is a process specific to database design and is typically more detailed than the high-level objectives of Phase C, which focuses on defining the overall data architecture and its alignment with the business architecture. Minimizing update anomalies through normalization would be part of the more detailed design activities that occur later in the process.
